title: Personalized romantic single-page website for Areebuu

requirements.text: Create a single-page romantic website experience addressed to the girlfriend named “Areebuu”, prominently featuring the nicknames: “Areebuu”, “Linnuu”, “cutie potato”, and “kuchhuu puchhu”, and include a sweet apology-style message in English.

quotes: My Gf is angry make something special for her, her name is Areebuu and I call her moslty Areebuu, Linnuu. Cutie potato and kuchhuu puchhu
Make something special like website page etc

acceptanceCriteria: The page content includes the exact strings: “Areebuu”, “Linnuu”, “cutie potato”, and “kuchhuu puchhu”.
All user-facing text on the page is in English.
The page reads as a cohesive romantic/special gesture (headline + short message at minimum).

requirements.text: Implement at least two lightweight interactive elements that make the page feel “special” (e.g., a “Reveal a message” interaction, a “Reasons I love you” card carousel, a “Tap for a surprise” animation, or a “Forgive me?” choice that results in a friendly outcome either way).

quotes: Make something special like website page etc

acceptanceCriteria: There are at least two distinct interactive UI elements (beyond basic scrolling).
Interactions work on both desktop and mobile sizes.
Interactions do not require login or backend calls.

requirements.text: Add one coherent, distinctive visual theme for the page (colors, typography, spacing, and component style) and apply it consistently across all sections; avoid a default/unstyled look. Do not use a blue/purple theme.

quotes: Make something special like website page etc

acceptanceCriteria: The page uses a consistent design system (palette + typography + spacing) across the full page.
The overall theme is not predominantly blue/purple.
Buttons, cards, and headings share consistent styling.

requirements.text: Create a simple sectioned layout suitable for a single-page romantic site, such as: Hero (name + headline), Message section, “Little things I love about you” section, and a closing section with a call-to-action (e.g., “Can we talk?” / “I want to make it right”).

quotes: Make something special like website page etc

acceptanceCriteria: The page contains at least 4 visually distinct sections.
The hero section includes “Areebuu” in a prominent headline.
The closing section includes a clear call-to-action element (button/link) that triggers an on-page interaction (modal/scroll/reveal), not external navigation.

requirements.text: Add the required generated images as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them in the page (e.g., background/hero illustration and small decorative elements). Do not serve images through the backend.

quotes: Make something special like website page etc

acceptanceCriteria: All generated images are placed in frontend/public/assets/generated.
The page loads and displays the generated images in the UI.
No backend endpoints are used to fetch or transform the images.

constraints: Use English for any user-facing text.
Frontend must use the existing React + TypeScript + Tailwind + React Query + shadcn setup; compose UI components without editing sources under frontend/src/components/ui.

Do not modify files under frontend immutablePaths (frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui).
Respect single-actor backend architecture; do not add extra backend services (no backend work is required for this request).
nonGoals: Internet Identity authentication or user accounts.
Storing messages or analytics on the backend.

required: Romantic soft-gradient background with subtle bokeh hearts (romantic-bg.dim_1920x1080.png)
Cute minimal heart-and-stars hero illustration, pastel style (hero-illustration.dim_1200x800.png)
Small decorative heart icon set, simple flat style (heart-icons.dim_256x256.png)
